job_description: About the job Position Job Title: Data Analyst, Alumni Engagement Services  Location: Vancouver (hybrid)  Reports To: Associate Director, Alumni Engagement Services  Primary Purpose  The Data Analyst, Alumni Engagement Services (AES) is a key member of the AES, overseeing and implementing data management practices to ensure effective use of constituent data. As an experienced data management professional, the analyst collaborates with team members engaging various constituents through events, volunteer roles, committees, boards, affinity, and lifelong learning opportunities. This supports the development and execution of meaningful alumni engagement strategies, fostering lifelong connections and advancing University Canada West's alumni relations goals.  The analyst works closely with Institutional Accountability, IT, Data and Privacy, Student Affairs and Services, and the Office of the Registrar to uphold data integrity. Responsibilities include data preparation, transformation, query writing, statistical analysis, and report preparation  Specific Responsibilities  DATA ANALYSIS AND REPORTING  Configure alumni database systems and oversees data entry and update to meet team needs.  Identify and categorize alumni according to established protocols for tracking linkages and interests. Ensure compliance with university data collection and management policies. Accountable for working with sensitive information and ability to maintain strict confidentiality. Design monthly statistical reports and dashboards to monitor key performance indicators. Manage alumni data imports/exports, conduct accuracy audits, and advise management. Provide statistical data for engagement activity development, conducting quantitative and qualitative research, analysis, and interpretation of alumni and constituent data. Conduct database analysis and assess needs, recommending technologies to support institutional research, predictive analysis, and meaningful alumni engagement.  Utilize statistical software for data analysis and stay updated on best practices in alumni data management. Develop protocols to safeguard alumni data and provide recommendations for approval.  RESEARCH  Provide analytical and research support for alumni initiatives, leveraging existing relationships to engage alumni and respond to their interests. Contribute to planning and implementing reports, data requests, and research. Proactively identify opportunities and manage projects to support data-informed decision-making, advancing university goals for increased alumni engagement. Independently develop methodologies and evaluation criteria based on recent trends in alumni relations and data management. Review literature in alumni relations, identify research opportunities, and share best practices with the alumni team and campus partners.  ALUMNI ENGAGEMENT STRATEGY  Utilize research and alumni data analysis to contribute to annual planning for alumni identification, cultivation, engagement, and stewardship. Collaborate with the team to create and deploy data analysis tools for monitoring objectives, metrics, and success indicators. Conduct surveys using institutional tools, translating results into visualizations or concise summaries.  PROGRAM AND EVENT SUPPORT  Configure database to facilitate seamless import/export of constituent participation and data capture for alumni benefits, programming, events, and communications, utilizing tools such as the alumni portal, Mailchimp, and virtual/in-person interactions. Collaborate with the team to monitor progress of programming and events towards key performance indicators.  FUND DEVELOPMENT AND EXTERNAL RELATIONS  Configure the database to track affinity partner promotions, event/program revenue, sponsorship engagement, and other revenue sources as directed. Conduct and manage constituent research to support team interactions with various stakeholders, including alumni, sponsors, affinity partners, campus champions, professional associations, university promotional materials, alumni recognition, and the Alumni Advisory Board. Conduct and track constituent research to support interactions with alumni, sponsors, affinity partners, campus champions, professional associations, university promotional materials, alumni recognition, the Alumni Advisory Board, and other stakeholders.  VOLUNTEER MANAGEMENT  Configure database to track alumni volunteer participation in university committees, events, panels, and external associations. Provide reports to the team on alumni volunteer involvement to monitor progress towards key performance indicators.  MARKETING AND COMMUNICATIONS  Configure database to support and track alumni communications, ensuring compliance with legislation and best practices. Manage returned email/mail, entering or distributing updates as needed. Present research results clearly through narrative, tables, graphs, and oral presentations using institutional software.  Design data formats, reports, charts, and graphics in line with graphic design standards. Create concise and user-friendly research briefs for a general audience.  RELATIONSHIP BUILDING  Offer recommendations to enhance institutional awareness of impactful alumni engagement, focusing on actionable insights, high-impact activities, and best practices for advancing alumni relationships. Collaborate with Institutional Accountability to integrate alumni engagement goals into routine campus reports, conducting research like campus-wide surveys and focus groups. Present research findings to various campus groups, including leadership, administration, and staff from Student Affairs & Services, Academic Affairs, Faculty, and the Registrar’s Office.   COLLABORATION AND SUPERVISION  While this role has no direct reports, it oversees supervision of the University’s alumni data systems.  Design and provide training on data entry and management protocols, use of monthly statistical reports and customized dashboards that monitor progress towards key performance indicators. Provide back-up for the operations assistant as required.  ADMINSTRATION AND FINANCE  Coordinate the import of alumni data with the Office of the Registrar into alumni data management systems as determined by annual schedule. Send pre-approved university and external partner messages and update alumni records. Identify and resolve duplicate records in the database through manual deletion or merging. Design reports and queries for mailings/invitations and assist with mail and email merges. Identify third party sources of information to improve and enhance database; remain current with trends in database technology. Act as the primary contact for technical support, troubleshooting issues, and recommending upgrades. Implement and monitor the assigned operational budget in accordance with university policies and procedures, ensuring financial goals are met. Prepare, review, and finalize reports on all data systems to support the development of annual operational budget.  Knowledge, Skills, And Abilities  Maintain a high degree of confidentiality and handles sensitive issues with tact. Proficient in reporting tools like Crystal Reports, capable of designing custom reports, dashboards, and pivot reports. Proactive approach to project identification, research, recommendation development, procedure creation, and implementation. Statistical experience in the social sciences or education. Ability to develop metrics, templates, and tools for continuous improvement tracking and monitoring of key indicators, promoting data-informed decision-making. Willingness to learn tools and technologies to support research, data analysis, and visualization. Detail-oriented with a focus on accuracy. Ability to work independently and manage projects under tight timelines. Adaptable to shifting priorities. Experienced in survey design.  Required Qualifications  Bachelor’s degree Two years of professional experience in data analysis and/or visualization. Intermediate knowledge of excel (including but not limited to VLOOKUP, pivot tables, calculations, basic visualizations, power pivot, and power query). Basic knowledge of statistical concepts and applications. Experience using constituent relationship management software.  Preferred Qualifications  Master’s degree. Experience conducting applied social/educational research and/or assessment projects. Three to five years of progressively responsible professional full-time experience in higher education or a non-profit organization. Experience data visualization tool with additional knowledge in using scripting language like R, Python, or SQL. Experience using data visualization tools such as Tableau or Power BI an asset.  Salary Range: $60,000-$70,000  To apply for this role, please submit your resume and cover letter in one PDF file.  We greatly appreciate your time and efforts in applying for the position at UCW, however, please note only successful candidates will be contacted.

why_me: With over two years of experience as a Data Analyst, I bring a strong background in data management, statistical analysis, and data visualization, which are essential for the Data Analyst, Alumni Engagement Services role at UCW. My achievements include developing predictive models that improved sales projections by 15% and optimizing data processing workflows, resulting in a 40% increase in efficiency. My proficiency in Python, SQL, and Power BI, along with my experience in creating custom dashboards and reports, aligns well with UCW's needs for effective data management and insightful reporting. I am passionate about using data to drive meaningful alumni engagement and support institutional goals. Additionally, my ongoing pursuit of mastering homemade pizza reflects my dedication to continuous improvement and creativity, qualities I look forward to bringing to UCW.

job_description: About the job Company Description  WHO ARE WE?  Dexterra Group is a fast-growing, financially strong, publicly listed company (TSX:DXT). We have a far-reaching presence across the entire continent North America with hundreds of full-time and part-time opportunities at any given time. We aim to provide our people with more than just a job – we offer fulfilling opportunities in a culture that promotes stability, diversity and inclusion, camaraderie, employee recognition, work-life balance, and doing what you love. For over 75 years, the companies that began independently, and now form Dexterra Group, have been dedicated to serving North American clients to create and manage built environments that play a vital role in our economy and our local communities. And, that’s something we’re truly proud of. Work That Matters, People Who Care.  , Job Description  WHAT’S THE JOB?  At Dexterra, we create exceptional customer experiences that make our clients shine. Powered by passionate people, we bring the right teams with the right skills together to turn problems into solutions and challenges into moments of ingenuity.  As a Human Resources Systems Analyst, reporting to the Manager, HR Client Services, you will have a keen analytical mindset to identify system and processes inefficiencies and propose effective solutions through effective communication and collaboration across diverse teams. This position offers the flexibility to work from home while contributing to our company’s HR initiatives.  As a member of the HR Service Centre, the HR Systems Analyst is responsible for configuring and maintaining the Human Resources Information System (HRIS), with a focus on union setup and benefit remittance management. This role requires a strong background in managing and configuring HR Information Systems, especially in environments with unionized employees. The HR System Analyst ensures the seamless integration of union requirements and benefit programs into the HRIS, accurate data management, and effective support for the workforce and operations.  Your work will include:  System Configuration & Maintenance  Configure and maintain configuration within ADP to meet ongoing business needs Coordinate with our Labour Relations Directors, Account Directors and HRSC to manage system changes and updates in relation to union contracts Understand contract requirements, including collective agreement implications to ensure accurate set up  Benefit Reconciliation:  Manage and administer payments of union employee benefits programs including health and wellness, retirement, and pension plans Perform regular reconciliation of union benefits to ensure accuracy and compliance with contractual agreements Act as the point of contact for monthly union benefit remittances Configure and maintain benefits module within the HRIS, including supporting documentation Ensure compliance with relevant regulations, collective agreements, and company policies Analyze discrepancies and resolve issues related to benefit calculations and payments.  Collaborate with payroll, operations, and finance to ensure accurate forecasting and benefit processing.   System Security and Support:  Provide technical support and troubleshooting to ADP users Develop and maintain user guides and training materials to assist users in system navigation and utilization Collaborate with IT and HR Teams to implement system upgrades and improvements Conduct regular security audits and assessments to ensure compliance Document workflows, security specifications and other HRIS configurations.   Auditing and Data Integrity:  Perform regular audits of processes and data to ensure integrity and accuracy Develop and implement audit plan and checklist to systematically review system operations and data handling Generate and analyze reports related to union membership, payments and benefit enrollment Provide insights and recommendations based on data analysis to improve HR processes and policies Identify and rectify any discrepancies or errors uncovered during audits  WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU?  Be #1 on day 1 by joining an industry leader Very competitive compensation package Fully remote work Advancement opportunities Benefits and RRSP matching on day one!  Follow Dexterra Group onLinkedIn.  , Qualifications  WHO ARE WE LOOKING FOR?  3-5 years’ experience as a System Analyst or similar role Demonstrated proficiency with analysis, design and development A bachelor’s degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or related field CHRP designation or working toward designation would be an asset Experience in unionized environments and benefits management Proficiency with HRIS platforms, specifically ADP Workforce Now Experience with HRIS implementations and upgrades.  Advanced level expertise with Excel and data analysis tools  Additional Information  Dexterra Group is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veterans’ status, Indigenous status, or any other legally protected factors. Disability-related accommodations during the hiring selection process are available upon request.  #IND3

job_description: About the job Job Title: Data Analyst  Job Description  As a Data Analyst, you will be integral in developing and implementing quality control plans for projects to ensure they meet established standards and customer requirements. Your role will involve optimizing processes, collaborating with cross-functional teams, and using data analytics to enhance project performance. You will be responsible for developing tools, maintaining a centralized data repository, and using statistical analysis to identify and address quality issues. Additionally, you will develop training materials, provide training, and communicate insights and recommendations directly to customers.  Hard Skills  Power BI Excel Data Visualization Statistical Analysis Quality Control Industrial or Manufacturing Experience  Soft Skills  Process Improvement Cross-functional Collaboration Communication Proactive Metrics Development Training & Development  Work Site  Vancouver  À propos d'Actalent:  Actalent est un chef de file mondial des services d’ingénierie et de sciences et des solutions de talents. Nous aidons les entreprises visionnaires à faire progresser leurs initiatives en matière d’ingénierie et de science en leur donnant accès à des experts spécialisés qui favorisent la mise à l’échelle, l’innovation et la mise en marché rapide. Avec un réseau de près de 30 000 consultants et plus de 4 500 clients aux États-Unis, au Canada, en Asie et en Europe, Actalent est au service d’un grand nombre d’entreprises du classement Fortune 500.  La diversité, l’équité et l’inclusion  Chez Actalent, la diversité et l’inclusion constituent le pont vers l’équité et la réussite de notre personnel. La diversité, l’équité et l’inclusion (DE&I) sont ancrées dans notre culture par :  L’embauche des talents diversifiés ; Le maintien d’un environnement inclusif par une autoréflexion permanente ; La mise en place d’une culture de soin, d’engagement, et de reconnaissance par des résultats concrets ; L’assurance des opportunités de croissance pour nos gens.  Actalent est un employeur souscrivant au principe de l’égalité des chances et accepte toutes les candidatures sans tenir compte de la race, du sexe, de l’âge, de la couleur, de la religion, des origines nationales, du statut d’ancien combattant, d’un handicap, de l’orientation sexuelle, de l’identité sexuelle, des renseignements génétiques ou de toute autre caractéristique protégée par la loi.  Si vous souhaitez faire une demande d’accommodement raisonnable, tel que la modification ou l’ajustement du processus de demande d’emploi ou d’entrevue à cause d’un handicap, veuillez envoyer un courriel à actalentaccommodation@actalentservices.com pour connaître d’autres options d’accommodement.  About Actalent  Actalent is a global leader in engineering and sciences services and talent solutions. We help visionary companies advance their engineering and science initiatives through access to specialized experts who drive scale, innovation and speed to market. With a network of almost 30,000 consultants and more than 4,500 clients across the U.S., Canada, Asia and Europe, Actalent serves many of the Fortune 500.  Diversity, Equity & Inclusion  At Actalent, diversity and inclusion are a bridge towards the equity and success of our people. DE&I are embedded into our culture through:  Hiring diverse talent Maintaining an inclusive environment through persistent self-reflection Building a culture of care, engagement, and recognition with clear outcomes Ensuring growth opportunities for our people  The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regard to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.  If you would like to request a reasonable accommodation, such as the modification or adjustment of the job application process or interviewing process due to a disability, please email actalentaccommodation@actalentservices.com for other accommodation options.

job_description: About the job Job Summary BC Financial Services Authority (“BCFSA”) helps to protect British Columbians during the biggest financial decisions in their lives. We regulate B.C. ’s financial services sector, including credit unions, real estate licensees, registered pension plans, insurance and trust companies and mortgage brokers. Through modern, effective and efficient oversight, BCFSA protects consumers by impartially setting and enforcing standards across the entire sector ensuring the prosperity of the province. BCFSA is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes applications from all groups. This includes Indigenous Peoples, women, visible minorities, persons with disabilities, persons of diverse sexual orientation, gender identity or expression (LGBTQ2S+), and others who may contribute to diversity at BCFSA. We recognize unique styles, perspectives, beliefs, and creativity that support a diverse, respectful, inclusive and collaborative work environment. To achieve this, we are committed to: • Hiring team members who represent the population we serve; • Removing barriers that may prevent equitable employment; and • Supporting respectful work environments where everyone feels included and able to produce excellent results. BCFSA is proud to be Great Place to Work Certified™. This is based on direct feedback from our Team Members. Our organization has also been selected as one of BC's Top Employers (2024) in recognition of our competitive compensation, work-life balance, and progressive programs.  WHAT WE OFFER:  When you join us, you become part of a high-performing team. Here, each Team Member can bring their unique talent to make outstanding contributions as we work towards the common goal of protecting British Columbians during the most important financial transactions in their lives. We offer: • Healthy living and work-life balance • Comprehensive health and wellness benefits plan • Opportunities for personal and professional development • Competitive compensation • A challenging and engaging team environment • Defined benefits pension plan which provides guaranteed income for life • Flexible work arrangement for eligible positions • Our team members enjoy the flexibility of a hybrid work model. They can choose every day where they want to work to be the most effective, from the comfort of their home to our beautiful office in downtown Vancouver. (Eligibility may vary, depending on position).  SUMMARY  This position supports the maturing of information management practices by leading records management initiatives, processing freedom of information requests, and supporting BCFSA’s privacy management program.  ACCOUNTABILITIES  Develops and implements strategies for maintaining sound records management practices, including optimizing storage, retrieval, archiving, and secure destruction of records processes. Supports BCFSA’s data strategy and mature data governance practices as required. Leads the implementation and maintenance of the corporate records management system, digitization and metadata standards, and information management projects, working with business and technical stakeholders, to meet regulatory and business requirements. Assigns or reviews document classification to ensure consistent application of the electronic records classification system compliant with ARCS and ORCS. Recommends coaching and training initiatives in records management tools and resources based on staff needs. Manages intake for FOI requests, including responding to applicants, providing guidance to staff, and estimating time required to locate and prepare information packages to support the Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act. Provides advice, recommendation and oversight to staff on requests for information and prepares information packages in response to FOI requests using established legislation, regulations, policies and guidance. Manages the collection of responsive material and arranges release of the material, including review and sign-off as appropriate. Seeks guidance on unusual matters and escalates files when matters are outside established criteria or where issues are contentious. Supports the corporate information sharing agreement program by maintaining the registry of agreements. Prepares privacy impact assessments and tracks initiatives or systems that have not been fully assessed for review by the Manager. Conducts privacy reviews of projects, programs, or initiatives as assigned by the Manager, and supports mitigating privacy breaches. Contributes to the team’s development of internal work practices (e.g., policies, procedures, and tools) and assigns work of the team, as well as managing the central inbox, reports on FOI requests, and contributes to the FOI Database. Contributes to, participates in, and supports organizational business transformation projects and initiatives.  JOB REQUIREMENTS Minimum 3 years of experience in related field. Knowledge of records management systems. Experience working in a confidential capacity and leading others. Knowledge of financial, records management, and information and privacy policies and procedures, the Information Management Act, ARCS/ORCS, and the Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act. Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships and communication with a variety of stakeholders. Excellent organizational skills to manage diverse workloads effectively and independently with high attention to detail. Proficiency in using Microsoft Office suite of products, including SharePoint. Knowledge of Microsoft Purview compliance centre is an asset. Ability to exercise judgement, initiative, and discretion. Ability to identify and recommend improvements to processes to advance service levels for both internal and external users. Excellent written and verbal communication skills and strong presentation skills. Work collaboratively with a variety of work teams. Strong preference will be given to candidates with experience in handling freedom of information requests and/or privacy impact assessments.  EDUCATION  Diploma or degree in business administration, public administration, records management, or equivalent, or combination of education and experience in records management, freedom of information, and/or privacy.  CORE COMPETENCIES  Building and Supporting Teams Shows enthusiasm toward being a member of the group; actively participates in team meetings and activities; leverages the skills and interests of coworkers to achieve goals and solve problems; supports team decisions. Communicating Effectively  Expresses ideas and information in a clear and concise manner; tailors’ message to fit the interests and needs of the audience; delivers information in a manner that is interesting and compelling to the listener. Customer Service  Handles internal and external questions and complaints, communicates with customers, handles service problems politely and efficiently, always available for the stakeholders, follows procedure to solve their problems, understands organization’s services, maintains a pleasant and professional image. Delivering High Quality Work Critically reviews work processes to ensure quality; addresses problems that could impact quality; makes sure project deliverables and services meet all requirements and expectations; does not make the same mistakes twice. Problem Solving/Analysis Breaks down problems into smaller components, understands underlying issues, can simplify and process complex issues, understands the difference between critical details and unimportant facts.  TECHNICAL COMPETENCIES  Document Management Efficiently organizes, stores, and retrieves documents. Maintains accurate records, follows document retention policies, and ensures that information is easily accessible to support smooth business operations.  PROVISOS Candidates must be eligible to work in Canada and living in British Columbia or intent to settle in the province. Internal candidates are kindly requested to use their BCFSA email address when applying for this position. This will help us identify and streamline the internal application process.  Hiring Process Accommodation  BCFSA wants to ensure every job applicant is treated fairly and with respect and encourages applications from all candidates, including those with diverse abilities. We welcome you to inform us confidentially if you may require any special support in the application process, including disability accommodation, in order to participate fully in our recruitment experience. Email us at careers@bcfsa.ca to notify us of any needs related to your job application.
why_this_company: BC Financial Services Authority’s mission to protect British Columbians during significant financial transactions resonates deeply with my values. The company's broad regulatory oversight across financial services including credit unions, real estate licensees, pension plans, insurance, trust companies, and mortgage brokers showcases its critical role in ensuring financial integrity and consumer protection. BCFSA’s reputation as an equal opportunity employer and its commitment to diversity and inclusion is impressive and aligns with my values. The accolade of being recognized among BC's Top Employers (2024) highlights its excellent culture and commitment to employee wellbeing. The organization's innovative approach towards creating a respectful, inclusive, and high-performing team environment aligns perfectly with my career aspirations to contribute to a forward-thinking and consumer-focused regulatory body. I am particularly excited about BCFSA’s flexible work arrangements and emphasis on personal and professional development, which would provide an ideal environment for me to grow and contribute meaningfully.
why_me: With over three years of experience in data and records management, I bring a wealth of knowledge and a proven track record of optimizing data workflows and enhancing decision-making processes. My achievements include developing a predictive model that increased sales forecast accuracy by 15% and improving data processing efficiency by 40% through Python automation scripts. My expertise in working with confidential data, managing complex document systems, and my strong analytical skills align perfectly with BCFSA’s needs. My collaborative spirit and passion for working in a regulated data environment will enable me to effectively contribute to the organization's mission. I am excited about the opportunity to further enhance BC Financial Services Authority’s information management practices, and I look forward to discussing how I can add value to your esteemed team, hopefully before perfecting my homemade pizza recipe!

job_description: About the job We are a leading financial services provider committed to making decisions easier and lives better for our customers and colleagues around the world. From our environmental initiatives to our community investments, we lead with values throughout our business. To help us stand out, we help you step up, because when colleagues are healthy, respected and meaningfully challenged, we all thrive. Discover how you can grow your career, make impact and drive real change with our Winning Team today.  Working Arrangement  Hybrid  Job Description  Collaborating with the Director, Data Design and Investment Division Data Lake (IDDL) Business Support, the Associate Data Analyst, will be a key member of a team of data professionals responsible for delivering key critical initiatives and establishing the data quality program for Manulife GWAM. They will couple their data analysis experience with a solid understanding of the Investment Division’s business and operations to implement the data strategy.  Responsibilities  You will work with Global Wealth Asset Management Operational Business &Technical Support teams, GWAM Business Teams (Finance and Risk) and the GWAM Chief Data Office to support the Investment Division Data Lake [IDDL] Daily Production activities to ensure data is available, reliable, consistent, accessible, secure, and timely through daily Data Issue Identification, Analysis and Action Planning. You will partner with the GWAM Chief Data Office Data Governance and Data Analytics, support on-going IDDL process improvements, including enhancements to GWAM Operational Capabilities, GWAM Data Quality Monitoring and Controls and GWAM Meta Data Management Tools such as the Business Glossary and Data Lineage. Working with different GWAM teams to support IDDL Design and Development for GWAM Strategic Initiatives.   How will you create impact?  The Chief Data Office (CDO) provides centralized oversight and coordination for any activities related to investment data. We provide standardized framework, operating structures, policies, and process to consistently govern and manage GWAM and GA data assets. The individual will be a key member of data design team to lead and support the growth of GWAM and GA data assets and critical data processes such as daily data quality deployment and monitoring.  What motivates you?  You obsess about customers, listen, engage and act for their benefit. You think big, with curiosity to discover ways to use your agile approach and enable business outcomes. You thrive in teams and enjoy getting things done together. You take ownership and build solutions, focusing on what matters.  You do what is right, work with integrity and speak up. You share your humanity, helping us build a diverse and inclusive work environment for everyone  What We Are Looking For  Highly analytical with strong consulting and problem-solving abilities; tenacity to identify the root cause of problems and apply innovative approaches to solve business data problems Strong service orientation Take personal accountability for issue analysis and resolution Asset management or financial services industry experience Previous experience in the management of large, firm-wide processes Strong communication skills Constructive challenge and influencing skills Experience in translating between business and technology worlds Champion of change and effectively managing the implementation of new ideas / improvements Confident when dealing with investment professionals, senior management and other partners Knowledge and experience with asset management systems and platforms such as trading/order management, portfolio accounting, client reporting, performance analytics and master data management Technical Skills, such as knowledge, of SQL required to perform data analysis  What can we offer you?  A competitive salary and benefits packages. A growth trajectory that extends upward and outward, encouraging you to follow your passions and learn new skills. A focus on growing your career path with us. Flexible work policies and strong work-life balance. Professional development and leadership opportunities.  Our commitment to you  Values-first culture We lead with our Values every day and bring them to life together. Boundless opportunity We create opportunities to learn and grow at every stage of your career. Continuous innovation We invite you to help redefine the future of financial services. Delivering the promise of Diversity, Equity and Inclusion We foster an inclusive workplace where everyone thrives. Championing Corporate Citizenship We build a business that benefits all stakeholders and has a positive social and environmental impact.  About Manulife And John Hancock  Manulife Financial Corporation is a leading international financial services group that helps people make their decisions easier and lives better. With our global headquarters in Toronto, Canada, we operate as Manulife across our offices in Asia, Canada, and Europe, and primarily as John Hancock in the United States. We provide financial advice, insurance, and wealth and asset management solutions for individuals, groups and institutions. At the end of 2022, we had more than 40,000 employees, over 116,000 agents, and thousands of distribution partners, serving over 34 million customers. At the end of 2022, we had $1.3 trillion (US$1.0 trillion) in assets under management and administration, including total invested assets of $0.4 trillion (US $0.3 trillion), and segregated funds net assets of $0.3 trillion (US$0.3 trillion). We trade as ‘MFC’ on the Toronto, New York, and the Philippine stock exchanges, and under ‘945’ in Hong Kong.  Manulife is an Equal Opportunity Employer  At Manulife/John Hancock, we embrace our diversity. We strive to attract, develop and retain a workforce that is as diverse as the customers we serve and to foster an inclusive work environment that embraces the strength of cultures and individuals. We are committed to fair recruitment, retention, advancement and compensation, and we administer all of our practices and programs without discrimination on the basis of race, ancestry, place of origin, colour, ethnic origin, citizenship, religion or religious beliefs, creed, sex (including pregnancy and pregnancy-related conditions), sexual orientation, genetic characteristics, veteran status, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital status, family status, disability, or any other ground protected by applicable law.  It is our priority to remove barriers to provide equal access to employment. A Human Resources representative will work with applicants who request a reasonable accommodation during the application process. All information shared during the accommodation request process will be stored and used in a manner that is consistent with applicable laws and Manulife/John Hancock policies. To request a reasonable accommodation in the application process, contact recruitment@manulife.com.  Salary & Benefits  The annual base salary for this role is listed below.  Primary Location  Toronto, Ontario  Salary range is expected to be between  $59,570.00 CAD - $110,630.00 CAD  If you are applying for this role outside of the primary location, please contact recruitment@manulife.com for the salary range for your location. The actual salary will vary depending on local market conditions, geography and relevant job-related factors such as knowledge, skills, qualifications, experience, and education/training. Employees also have the opportunity to participate in incentive programs and earn incentive compensation tied to business and individual performance.  Manulife offers eligible employees a wide array of customizable benefits, including health, dental, mental health, vision, short- and long-term disability, life and AD&D insurance coverage, adoption/surrogacy and wellness benefits, and employee/family assistance plans. We also offer eligible employees various retirement savings plans (including pension and a global share ownership plan with employer matching contributions) and financial education and counseling resources. Our generous paid time off program in Canada includes holidays, vacation, personal, and sick days, and we offer the full range of statutory leaves of absence. If you are applying for this role in the U.S., please contact recruitment@manulife.com for more information about U.S.-specific paid time off provisions.
why_this_company: Manulife’s unwavering commitment to making decisions easier and lives better greatly appeals to me. Their global presence and comprehensive range of financial services, including insurance and wealth and asset management solutions, demonstrate their leadership in the industry. I am particularly impressed by their dedication to values-driven business practices and their proactive approach to environmental and community investment initiatives. Manulife’s inclusive culture and strong emphasis on professional growth align perfectly with my career aspirations. The company's reputation for innovation and corporate citizenship excites me, as it would allow me to contribute to impactful initiatives while growing professionally in a supportive environment.
why_me: With over two years of experience as a Data Analyst, I possess the technical expertise in Python, SQL, and Power BI, which are essential for the Associate Data Analyst role at Manulife. My accomplishments include engineering a predictive model that increased sales projection accuracy by 15% and optimizing data processing workflows to boost efficiency by 30%. I hope to discuss my fit for this role soon, ideally before perfecting my homemade pizza recipe!

job_description: About the job About Us  The Ontario Cannabis Store provides safe, responsible access to recreational cannabis for adults 19 and older. We operate the sole legal online store for recreational cannabis in Ontario and are the provincial wholesaler of cannabis for private retail stores.  Working at the OCS is a unique opportunity to be part of an agile start-up in a ground-breaking new industry. We’re a diverse team passionate about delivering a great customer experience, working together with mutual respect and building value out of our differences. We’re an inclusive organization that understands that delivering great results comes out of ensuring every voice is heard.  About the Role  We're seeking an exceptional IT Data Analyst to join our vibrant Enterprise Data & Analytics team. As a key member of the team, you will play a pivotal role in developing reports, dashboards, and visualizations tailored to the needs of our business stakeholders and empower business teams to make data-driven decisions with confidence. Employing descriptive data analysis techniques, you will uncover actionable and valuable insights from our datasets, driving informed decision-making across the organization.   About Your Day  Develop new reports and dashboards/visualizations for internal stakeholders who are unable to self-serve. Collaborate with stakeholders to define key performance indicators (KPIs) and develop reporting frameworks to track and measure performance against established metrics. Maintain and enhance existing reports in accordance with business objectives. Implement data visualization best practices to create intuitive and impactful reports and dashboards that facilitate data-driven decision-making. Identify, analyze and interpret trends or patterns in multifaceted datasets. Conduct ad-hoc analysis and data mining to answer specific business questions or address emerging issues. Conduct in-depth analysis to uncover patterns, trends, and insights from data using descriptive and predictive analytics. Apply statistical and machine learning techniques to analyze large datasets and derive actionable insights to drive business decisions. Work closely with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and translate them into data science solutions. Partner with data engineers and architects to design and optimize data models and infrastructure for efficient data storage and retrieval. Train and onboard business analysts to build Dashboards and Reports using analytical datasets in Enterprise Data Platform. Communicate analytical solutions to internal stakeholders and provide recommendations for business process improvements.   About You    Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or related field of study or equivalent level of education and experience. 2+ years of experience in Business Intelligence development roles working with data and analytic tools such as Power BI. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to analyze complex datasets and extract meaningful insights. Demonstrated experience in Data Analytics & Visualizations tools such as Power BI Intermediate to Advanced programming skills in Power BI, SQL and Python. Familiarity with Cloud Platforms such as Azure. Strong written and verbal communication skills Proven experience with eCommerce, Retail and Business Analytics is preferred Completion of certifications in Power BI or related tools and/or technologies is an asset Experience of data warehousing, data modeling concepts and building new data warehouse tables would be an asset. Demonstrated knowledge of machine-learning and predictive modeling Understanding of and hands-on experience with Version Control Systems (VCS) such as, GIT, CVS, SVN, etc. is preferred  About the Job This position currently offers a hybrid work schedule. The current in office requirement is a minimum of 3 days/week (may be more depending on business needs). The OCS office is located near York Mills and Yonge Street. However, OCS reserves the right to change this policy and its office location at any time. City: Toronto, ON Employment Type: Permanent, Full- Time Required Travel: Rare, usually within the GTA   Compensation The target hiring range for this position is $60,000- $85,000. This is a pay grade 5B role, with a salary range of $60,684.73 - $ 92,511.96. Placement in the salary range will be based on factors such as market conditions, internal equity, and candidate experience, skills, and qualifications relevant to the role.   We are committed to providing an accessible, equitable and inclusive candidate and employee experience. We provide reasonable accommodation throughout the recruitment process and in employment. If you require an accommodation please let us know, we will work with you to meet your needs.
why_this_company: The Ontario Cannabis Store's mission to provide safe and responsible access to recreational cannabis aligns with my values of promoting responsible consumption and public safety. As the sole legal online store for recreational cannabis in Ontario and the provincial wholesaler for private retail stores, OCS stands out in the market for its commitment to quality and customer satisfaction. I am particularly drawn to OCS's inclusive culture and the emphasis on mutual respect and diversity, which fosters a collaborative and innovative work environment. The opportunity to be part of an agile start-up in a groundbreaking industry excites me, as it aligns perfectly with my career aspirations to grow within a dynamic and forward-thinking organization. I am eager to contribute to OCS's mission and be part of a team that values every voice and drives impactful results.
why_me: With over two years of experience as a Data Analyst, I bring a strong background in data visualization, machine learning, and big data analysis, which are crucial for the IT Data Analyst role at OCS. My achievements include developing predictive models that enhanced sales projections by 15% and boosting data processing efficiency by 40% through custom Python scripts. My proficiency in Power BI, SQL, and Python, along with my experience in cloud platforms like Azure, aligns well with the technical requirements of this role. I am passionate about leveraging data to drive informed decision-making and improve business processes. Additionally, my collaborative nature and problem-solving skills make me a great fit for OCS's diverse and inclusive team. I look forward to discussing how I can contribute to OCS's success, hopefully before perfecting my homemade pizza recipe!
